sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It is Thursday, the 15th of September. I'm Helena Humphrey, and here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A brief moment of celebration for Ukraine's President Zelensky as he awards medals to his troops in newly liberated areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But Russia continues its assault on the Northeast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sweden's prime minister concedes defeat in parliamentary elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A four-party right-wing coalition, including the nationalist Sweden Democrats, will now come to power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And Queen Elizabeth II lies in state at the Palace of Westminster in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Thousands queue for hours to pay their respects to the late monarch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Medals for the heroes of liberation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky hands out awards to some of the soldiers who recaptured the town of Balaklia in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Kyiv has captured around 8,000 square miles from Russia, mostly in the northeast of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But now it's time to rebuild. The damage from over six months of occupation is all too clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Zelensky says everything needs restoring.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: His office later released a photo of what Kyiv says was a retaliatory strike on a local town's hydraulic system. There are now fears of flooding. Russia, in its own words at least, is fighting back fiercely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Moscow's chief defense ministry spokesman said that it conducted massive strikes in the northeast, killing and wounding 150 Ukrainian soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: northeast, killing and wounding 150 Ukrainian soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But will Russia gain solace from this man? China's leader Xi Jinping will likely meet his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin in Uzbekistan, where they're both attending an international summit. So far, Beijing has refused to criticize Moscow's actions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So far, Beijing has refused to criticise Moscow's actions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Shelling between Armenia and Azerbaijan appears to have stopped after reports of a negotiated ceasefire following a flare-up of fighting that killed 155 soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: An official on Armenia's Security Council announced the truce, saying it took effect at 8pm on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, there was no comment from Azerbaijan's government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Armenia and Azerbaijan have traded blame for the hostilities, with Armenian authorities accusing Baku of unprovoked aggression, while Azerbaijani officials say they're paying a grave price as their country responded to Armenian shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A renewal of violence between the two states on the edge of Europe is of concern to EU members.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This conflict makes no sense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It costs human lives and it must be solved peacefully, with each other, between the two states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The hopeful beginnings, which at least existed, are now of course endangered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Nevertheless, we have to work with all of our strength from the side of the European Union, also from the side of our country and many others to make it possible that a peaceful development between the countries becomes possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: to make it possible that a peaceful development between the countries becomes possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The dispute between the neighboring republics over the Nagorno-Karabakh region led to wars in the 1980s and 1990s and continuing clashes for decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Although internationally recognized as part of Azerbaijan, the region is populated by ethnic Armenians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As part of Azerbaijan, the region is populated by ethnic Armenians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Swedish Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson will resign on Thursday after a bloc of four conservative parties won the parliamentary elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Andersson, the leader of the Social Democrats, accepted defeat of her center-left coalition in a speech last night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The four right-wing parties seem to have barely 50 percent of the vote in the elections and they have an advantage of one or two seats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's a narrow majority, but it's a majority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So tomorrow I will hand in my resignation as prime minister and the responsibility to continue the process will be taken over by the Speaker of Parliament and the Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The far-right Sweden Democrats, led by this man, Yimmi Ã…kesson, took around 20% of votes after an election campaign focused on anti-immigration policies. Ulf Kristersson is the leader of the conservative moderate party, which won a fifth of votes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He is now expected to form a new government with the Sweden Democrats and two other right-wing parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sweden's election results mark the end of an eight-year left-leaning coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The results from the Swedish general elections are now in,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: and we now know that it was the parties on the right that ended up winning this general election, because after several days of counting the last votes, and it was a very, very tight race all the way to the end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Magdalena Andersson, Sweden's prime minister and also the leader of the Social Democratic Party, came out telling Sweden that she has now admitted defeat, and on Thursday she will head to parliament and hand in her resignation to the Speaker of Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: She did, however, say, though, in her press conference that she's worried because the second largest party in this election is the controversial party, of parliament. She did, however, say, though, in her press conference that she's worried because the second largest party in this election is the controversial party, the Sweden Democrats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Magdalena Andersson said that a lot of people in Sweden might be worried right now and that she shares this worry. On the winning side, however, with their celebration, the leader of the Christian Democratic Party, for example, Ebba Bush, has come out saying Sweden voted for a change of government and we're ready to step into that role.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The leader of the moderate party, Ulf Kristersson, is expected to be Sweden's new prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He's also come out saying thank you so much for the confidence. However, it might take several days and even weeks before we actually have a new government in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: First, there needs to be some difficult negotiations between these parties to the right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Should the Sweden Democrats be included in the government, or should they just be a supporter of the new government?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For now, though, Magdalena Andersson remains in power as a caretaker government until the new prime minister is in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Per Bergfors Nyberg, Euronews, Stockholm, Sweden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Queen Elizabeth II is lying in state in Westminster Hall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Her coffin, draped in the royal standard with the glittering imperial state crown atop, will remain there until her state funeral on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: British monarchs since Edward the seventh have lain in state in this same hall. It's a place where the palace meets Parliament in ancient splendor. For the next four days the public will have the chance to pay their respects and thousands are expected to file past, some curious, others more reflective. It was a very emotional experience. It's surreal. It's like we queued for six, seven hours and then it was over so quickly. But inside it was amazing. It was really quiet and you just couldn't help but feel emotional that it's finally sunk in. I'm from Malaysia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And we brought up knowing that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I'm sorry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I didn't actually know she meant that much to me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It was very emotional inside. Beautiful place. The crown was glistening. The Queen to me is my female role model and she did us proud.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Monday's funeral will take place in Westminster Abbey when foreign leaders will also be invited.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Plenty more coming up after a short break, so don't go anywhere.
